reviews.text: This old school complex has a mixture of residences, shops, offices related to textiles and eateries. It has became quite dead in the past few years but kind of resurrected by an evangelical church at the top floor. There is good view of the neighbourhood from the carpark.

Textile Center Flea Market every 2 weeks; Sunday one time. Many interesting vendors selling clothes, prepackaged food, preloved items, such as toys, clothes, accessories wear like modern and classic earrings, necklace, watches etc.The event organiser is a father David and son Johson Chan, very friendly team. Please come to join in the fun and pickup a good bargain to bring home. Cheers!

Many old offices are located here. Some have been here since the 70s, and likely bought and not rented.

2 anchor tenants are Maybank on level 1 and a Church on the 4th floor.

A few of the shops are owned by the same landlords since it was cheaper to buy back in those days.

Now, most of the textile shops are gone, even though the name stays. Many shops are rented by PRC nationals doing businesses to cater to the many KTVs or pub hostesses there.

Other common trades also include car dealers and credit and insurance firms with 1 or 2 cafeteria for the tenants as well.

The residential here is far better than nearby apartments , location is good as I can walk to lavender mrt (green line)or Nicoll highway station(yellow line) less than 7 minutes.
lots of convenient eateries nearby even within the building itself there few affordable cafe, home cooked style!

Mall seemed to be deserted but surprisingly the toilet was cleaned.

Parking was supposed to fit 3 cars but it was too packed to fit 3 cars.

Lift didn't stop even it says serving the floor. Waited few times for the lift to stop at level 5 from parking lot. Wanted to take the escalators that time but I waited few moment then it was stopped.
